intro: Jaltomata dilloniana, commonly known as Dillon's groundcherry, is a species of flowering plant in the Solanaceae family. It is native to the southeastern United States, particularly Florida and Georgia. The plant produces small, yellow-orange berries that are edible when ripe. It typically grows in moist, open habitats such as sandhill prairies and hammocks. Its botanical features include hairy stems, lobed leaves, and a short flowering period in the summer.
